task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the fixed goal marker, align the end-effector, push the block toward the marker, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows a T-shaped block and a robot arm with a circular tool tip. The goal is to push the T-block from its initial pose to a fixed goal location on the board. The behavior first ensures both the block and target are detected, then aligns the tool with the blockâ€™s pushing face, sets a stable yaw, performs a straight push for a fixed distance, and finally retreats and waits to settle. The control/observation cadence is nominally 10 Hz.
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to the T-block with tight tolerance.
Set yaw for a straight-line push toward the target.
Push the block a fixed distance toward the goal.
Retreat to avoid disturbing the final pose.
Briefly wait to allow motion to settle.
success_criteria: T-block ends within the goal region
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: re-run detection and re-approach.
Misalignment or slip: re-approach with the same tolerance and repeat push with smaller distance.
Overshoot: retreat and plan a corrective push in the opposite direction.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the retreat and wait once the push completes or if detection repeatedly fails.

frame_3.now_evidence: Clear first push motion with contact established and alignment cue visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Continuation of push and expected translation toward goal.

frame_5.now_evidence: Largest visible displacement of the T-block.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Approach and align the tool to the T-block face.
Orient tool for a straight push.
Execute the push toward the goal.
Back off to avoid disturbing final pose.

failure_modes: Target or block not detected due to occlusion or lighting
Block rotates unpredictably due to friction anisotropy
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection and re-approach before pushing again
Reduce push distance to 0.05 and repeat
Adjust yaw to 0 or 135 degrees if drift observed
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a small blue circle on the board; instruction mentions gray block and green target. We treat the blue circle as the fixed goal marker.
End-effector appears cylindrical; treated as a circular tip per instruction.

expected_success_criteria: Post-push, block centroid overlaps the goal marker region
